script: But even here, on the Earth's frozen bottom, we find life.
Joyous, frolicking, waddling, cute and cuddly life.
Look at them tumbling onto their chubby bum-bums.
Who could take these frisky little snow clowns...
Does anyone even know where we're marching to?
We'll just fly to the front of the line and see for ourselves.
Skipper, we appear to be flightless.
Aw, well, what's the point of these?
Hey, this could be our thing!
What are we gonna call it?
Is someone gonna go get it?
Well, it's a dangerous world out there, and we're just penguins.
You know, nothing but cute and cuddly.
Yeah. Why do you think there are always documentary crews filming us?
You know, we lose a few eggs every year.
I guess that makes sense, but...
something deep down in my gut tells me that it-it makes no sense at all.
No one's ever returned from there alive.
There's a bird down there now.
How should I know? I live on the flipping frozen tundra.
SKIPPER: They're going for the egg!
Give me a way down there, ASAP!
All one would have to do is collect 300 feet of kelp, dry it in the...
Tiny and helpless, the baby penguins are frozen with fear.
They know if they fall from this cliff, they will surely die.
KOWALSKI: ...harnessing the jellyfish we've trained to obey simple voice commands.

KOWALSKI: I'd recommend firing it now.
Uh, we really should fire it.
Not till we see the white of its eyes.
They got to have a little bit of white, right?
We are really awesome at this.
Hey, hey, we can do our thing.
I think I have amniotic sac in my mouth!
You don't have a family, and we're all going to die. Sorry.
What? I-I thought that was what we were all nodding about.
And if that ain't a family, I don't know what is.
And the, uh, other five percent?

I swear it's gonna make me lose my salmon.
Somebody get that wig off Private.
I'm really getting tired of this song.

Ten years ago on this very day, a tiny egg hatched, and our world got a little bit cuter.
So tonight, Private, we celebrate your birthday by infiltrating the United States gold depository at Fort Knox!
The object of our unholy desire.
Private, what's our rule about interrupting analogies?
Are you questioning my leadership, Private?
'Cause I respect a soldier with some moxie.
Really? Then I really think we should...

AUTOMATED MALE VOICE: Please enter pass code.

They do love their Flatt and Scruggs.

Private, if you could have anything you wanted in the whole wide world, what would it be?
Well, gee, Skipper, I think to be a meaningful and valued member of this team.
Ah. Well, we got you something else.
Well, not just any vending machine, Private.
The last remaining home in America's nanny state for those succulent but chemically hazardous bits of puffed heaven called...

You mess with the bull, you're gonna get the horns, Private.
Now, hit that machine and get your present.
We just broke into the most secure facility in North America.
We're wanted criminals who'll be on the lam the rest of our lives, always feeling the hot breath of Johnny Law on our necks?
SKIPPER: No! It means, as elite units go, we're the elitest of the elite.
I don't think I like your attitude, vending machine.
I ate too many Cheezy Dibbles.
We're behind enemy lines and incredibly thirsty.
Rico, bust us out of this delicious prison.
You are a meaningful and valued member of this team.
Dark and ominous-- two of my least favorite traits in a room.
Now, what have I told you about...
It looks like some sort of giant laser sent to kill us all, sir.
Pretty birds belong in their cages.
And I was so happy to see you again.
The humans know me as Dr. Octavius Brine.
Renowned geneticist, cheese enthusiast, and frequent donor to NPR pledge drives.
But you know me by a different, much older name.
A name perhaps you'd hoped you'd never hear again.
A shadow of a former life!
You may not remember me, but I could never forget you.
Let's shake up some old memories.
Roomy tank, great location, monkey-house views.
The octopus of a thousand tricks.
Just, uh, smile and wave, boys.
WOMAN: Have you ever seen anything cuter?
With you around, no one wanted an old octopus anymore.
And so it went, over and over, at zoo after aquarium.
I can't see the penguins, man!
I came to realize some creatures are born to get all the love.
The rest of us get nothing!
The only thing that has kept me going all these years is my burning thirst for revenge!
And my precious souvenir snow globe collection.
Oh, Daryl, Daryl, Daryl, you can't blame us for what happened to you.
That's how this whole revenge thing works.
And with this, I finally have the power to destroy you.
I've got some bad news for you, Dennis.
You messed with the wrong birds.
Because we are an elite unit, the best of the best.
Cream of the corn on a platinum cob.
And we're gonna take your deadly green goop and sashay right out the exit hatch.
And just how are you going to do that?
All right, boys, it's just like Cuba.
Ha! So you squeegees want to do the gondola mambo?
And we are running out of canal.
Frankly, I'm surprised we had a self-destruct sequence.

Now we, uh, spring our trap.

Kowalski, remember our little talk about true but unhelpful comments?

Sorry for underestimating the plan, Skipper.
Just don't ever doubt me again.
Now, what the heck is going on?!
You are now under the protection of the North Wind.
Aw, you guys are so cute.
You guys are just so, so cute!
It's like being licked by a basket full of puppy dogs.
Chart a course back to North Wind headquarters.
Eva, inform them that we're bringing in witnesses.
We're not going anywhere with you.
We don't even know who the heck you are.
The North Wind is an elite undercover interspe...
The North Wind is an elite under...
Dedicated to helping animals who can't help themselves.
My name is classified because I am the leader of this strike team.
The seal is Short Fuse-- weapons and explosives.
The bear is Corporal-- he's our muscle.
And the owl is Eva-- intelligence and analysis.
Well, Agent Classified, we happen to be an elite unit, too.
You know, you should really label these things.
FEMALE VOICE: In three, two, one...
He's the brains of our operation.
See? He's working on a whole nother level.
And Rico, he's our demolition expert.

he's sort of our, uh, you know, secretary/mascot.
Well, let's see how well cute and cuddly handles this next bit.
Not a bad place you got here, Classified.
All right, tiny penguins, the best way for the North Wind to protect helpless animals like yourselves is to bring Dr. Brine to justice.
Now, you were inside his sub, so I need to know everything you know.
Just tell me everything you know.
All right. Numero uno: Never trust a Dutchman in a tulip fight.
Canada is secretly training an army of Sasquatch.
Hot dogs are, in fact, only 17 percent actual dog.
Just everything regarding your abduction by Dr. Octavius Brine.
My team has uncovered that Dr. Octavius Brine is actually an individual known as Derek.
Dr. Brine is not an octopus.
That's exactly what our intel indicated.
What you, of course, could not know is that Dr. Brine's laboratory in Venice is secretly developing a doomsday weapon called the Medusa Serum.
Ah, but what you don't know is that Dirk...
Dave won't be using his bazooka serum...
Well, stole the serum, saved the day, did your job for you.
Click on the button with the picture of the microphone.
Every time a villain calls in, this happens.
Now we can hear you, but we cannot see you.
It's like talking to my parents.
Yes, we've got you; that's fantastic.
I see you've met my old zoo-mates.
You're powerless now that I've stolen your precious Medusa Serum.
Then why did I call you?
Oh, maybe it was to show you this.
That is a lot of serum for four penguins.
Oh, you thought this was just about you four?
No, no, no, no, no, no.
Now, if you'll excuse me, I have to go do some shopping...
BOTH: We have to move! What?
I'm initiating North Wind Protocol Zeta.
12 more penguins taken from London Zoo.
The mission we've been preparing for our entire lives.
We're gonna take down Dave or die trying.
Private, do that little thing I like.
I got them to credit our class.
This mission has no place for a pathetic waddle of useless penguins!
See, Rico, that's why you can't have nice things.
I'm, uh, pretty good with computers myself.

I want these butterballs out of my way and out of my mission.
Ship them to one of our safe houses.
The most remote place on the planet.
I suggest we limit our breathing.
We must be on a plane.
What did North Wind do to us?
That low-down dirty dog is trying kick us off the mission.
He thinks we can't save the penguins because we're just penguins.
Well, penguins are our flesh and feathers.
And if anyone's gonna save us, it's us.
But, Skipper, we've got to be five miles up.
That pretty much limits our options.
Brilliant move, Skipper, but now we seem to be outside the plane.
Well, kind of got caught up in the moment.
Okay, Kowalski, your turn to pick up the slack.
Oh, why don't we catch that plane?
KOWALSKI: We've got another target at 12 o'clock.
No one likes a show-off, Private.
Kowalski, where does this aircraft go?
From the odd shape of this bagel, I'd say we're headed for Paris.
Then I would suggest a mid-air transfer.
Peanuts, peanut, peanut, peanut, peanut, peanut, peanut!
Yeah? Then we're leaving just time, 'cause these folks are gonna freak!

Crikey! We're not gonna catch it!
Oh, Private, stop playing with those backpacks.
It's clear what we need to do next.
If we're gonna take Dexter down, we need to know where he's gonna strike next.
Elijah, would you please take them away.
Rub the angry out of the tummy.
We are going to save those helpless penguins, because...
we are the North Wind, and no one...
Now, we rescued those four penguins already, didn't we?
Shipped them off all cozy and snug to a Madagascar...

Well, where the dickens are they?
From my calculations, we've arrived in the center of Dublin, Ireland.
All right, soldiers, we got to blend in.
No time to kiss the Blarney stone, boys.
We need to find intel on Dave's location, pronto.
Stranded on the Emerald Isle without a single clue.
Well, so much for the luck o' the Irish.
No. But it looks like Dave's been busy.
It's every zoo and aquarium he got kicked out of!
Don't tell me where he has been, tell me where he will have has been next.
It's a film! It's a play!
Dave hasn't been there yet, Skipper.
If we hurry, we can still stop him.
It's time to blow this potato stand.

Dave's next target-- Shanghai's famous mermaid penguins.
And once again, you've proved that you are a meaningful and valued member of this team.

Stay safe, little guys, wherever you are.
And we hope you come home real soon.
Now, keep those eyes roving, boys.
Dave is a master of disguise.
He could be a small child, a house plant, maybe even you or me!
Operation Flash, Splash and Crash is a go!
Penguin feeding time will begin in two minutes.

But I can do more, Skipper.
I want to help the team.
If you think I'm ready, Assuming you agree.

Oh, what are you doing out here, cutie?
Secure the mermaids and find me...

He's going in through the pipes!
You got to get out of there!
But can you fly it, man?
There's only one way to find out.

I'm getting the hang of this, Skipper.

No, no, no, no, no, no, no!
Self-destruct sequence in five, No, Private!

Kowalski is sick as a dog.
And Rico keeps trying to eat him.
Just, please, just cut it out.
Not sure how long we can hold on.
This may be my final entry.
EVA: Mmm, the salmon is delicious.

Let me cut you a piece of the salmon.

We've been tracking your little secretary/mascot.

All I need is a test subject.
Behold, as I unleash the full power of the Medusa Serum.

I-I mean, you know, intertwined, physically, but...

If we're gonna pull this off, we'll need a diversion.

Nope! This is our plan, and it requires you to cause a diversion.
Die, die, die, die, die, die!

With Private freshly liberated, we celebrate with a well-earned high one, and feast off Dave's sweet remains.

you... you certainly know a good plan-- I mean, your operation in Shanghai allowed Dave to escape with... your boy.

it's time we leave it to the professionals.

fireworks may have been a tactical mistake.

Oh, well, this is why we test things, people.
I'll have to lower the power for the others.

All right, agents, we are back in business.

But the penguins are in danger!
So, because you failed once, you're just running away?
And we are not running away.

he'd never leave a man behind.
Well, I suppose we can't all be penguins, can we?
Big smiles for the Big Apple!
You turn us into freaks, and then what?
You think that's gonna make everybody love you?
And I'm sure gonna love that.
The missing penguins have been found!
Okay. According to my notes, genetic researcher Dr. Octavius Brine has found the penguins and is bringing them here to New York's Battery Park.
Penguin lovers of the world, guess who I found.
It wasn't easy, but seeing the penguins get what they deserve will make it all worthwhile.
What a weird thing to say!
It's like I can still hear his little voice calling to us.

You have a great otter, there.

Well, the fun and games are just beginning.
And when the exterminators take you away, you never come back.
Oh, no. Oh, no. Oh, no.

You've got to get a grip!

Did she say my name specifically?
This feels a little awkward, but I'm happy.
You need to listen to us.
I guess you're kind of the same either way.

Sir, how long do we stand here like this?
Now all we need is a plan.
Well, I figured if we could reverse the ray, we could turn everyone back to normal.

now that I have my revenge, I feel... empty, as if what I needed all along was...

you are the most meaningful and valued member of this team.

uh, um, this is difficult for me to say.

you four are the bravest agents I've ever known.
